name: awearness
tagline: a simple vibrating/flashing wristband to remind you!
body:
# awearness
## What is awearness?
awearness is a anwesome (at least we think it is) wristband created at the [JugendHackt](http://jugendhackt.de) Hackathon (an awesome Hackathon for humans between 11 and 18 years in Berlin).

Actually it is quite simple: It is a 3d-printed wristband which connects to a smartphone via Bluetooth Low Energy. Then the smartphone is able to trigger a vibration or a blinking LED of the wristband. The Idea is to remind you of certain things and there are several ideas:

* Vibration when a surveillance camera is nearby
* Vibration when you're in front of a supermarket and need to buy something
* Vibration when you're driving to fast with your car
* ...

## Where can I get it?
awearness is – as you might guess – an open-source wristband. You can find the code that was pushed while JugendHackt in [Jugendhackt/awearness](https://github.com/jugendhackt/awearness). We'll move the repositories to the awearness organization and push the missing code soon!

## The wristband
The wristband itself is 3d-printed what gives surprising good results.

This is a picture of [the first prototype](https://github.com/Jugendhackt/awearness/commit/0d2273f3fde345a29f7bfb83331e38b4e3297423):

![](https://pbs.twimg.com/media/BxcrzJAIgAAa3A4.jpg:large)
